subject: Physical Fitness
title: The Birth of the Modern Gym
description: Learn The Birth of the Modern Gym in one minute.

hook.text: In 1848, a Frenchman named Hippolyte Triat opened a lavish gym in Paris. It looked nothing like today's boxes.

buildup.text: Triat's gymnasium featured ornate mirrors, gaslight chandeliers, and rows of barbells. Fitness met elegance.

discovery.text: He charged membership fees and offered group classes â€” inventing the gym business model still used today.

twist.text: Before Triat, physical training happened outdoors or in military settings. He made fitness an indoor, civilian activity.

climax.text: His idea spread across Europe. By 1900, commercial gymnasiums existed in every major city.

punchline.text: One Parisian gym invented memberships, group classes, and mirrors. Familiar?

quiz.question: What business model innovations did Hippolyte Triat introduce?
options: Membership fees and group fitness classes
